text:
PA/TIM ROOKE/ REX/ SHUTTERSTOCK

Doting Granddad: Charles has spoken of the joy of having a third grandchild

The heir to the throne, who turns 70 this year, said it was a “great joy” to become a grandad again.

Princess Kate and delighted dad Prince William took their new arrival home from hospital on Monday night.

The royal bundle, who weighed 8lb 7oz, is settling in at Kensington Palace with his brother George, four, and two-year-old sister Charlotte.

Doting Prince Charles said: “It is a great joy to have another grandchild.

“The only trouble is I don’t know how I am going to keep up with them.”

Princess Kate is now torn over whether to take her new baby to Prince Harry’s wedding to Meghan Markle on May 19.

Insiders fear there is a risk it could overshadow the Suits star’s big day.

The guests’ attention could be divided on catching another glimpse of the tiny prince as well as the bride.

Princess Charlotte and Prince George will be flower girl and page boy.

PA

Princess Charlotte and Prince George have important roles to play in the Royal Wedding

With husband Wills being best man, Kate will have to make sure the young children perform their duties.

The Duchess may be forced to leave her newborn with a nanny, which is uncommon at such a young age.

And ITV also unveiled huge plans for its royal wedding coverage.

GETTY

Distraction: Kate may be worried that her new baby will distract from the wedding day

Phillip Schofield will front the all-day show with newsreader Julie Etchingham in a specially constructed studio at Windsor Castle.

They will be on air from 9.25am to 3pm.

ITV will also air four hour-long shows dedicated to the May 19 nuptials.

A documentary called Invitation To A Royal Wedding will count down to the big day and the two-part Royal Wives Of Windsor will focus on the women who married into the monarchy.

And the fourth prime-time special is scheduled to be Prince Harry’s Story: Four Royal Weddings.
